Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer, java.io.Serializable
public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observer, java.io.Serializable
This class controls the evolution of the Game. Messages are read and responses are elaborated.
See Also:
Serialized Form

    • win

      public void win()
      Broadcasts the winner, disconnects all clients and resets whole game.

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      Reset the Game Instance and re-initialize GameController Class.

    • loginHandler

      public void loginHandler​(java.lang.String nickname, VirtualView virtualView)
      Handles the login of a player. If the player is new, his VirtualView is saved, otherwise it's discarded and the player is notified. If it's the first Player then ask number of Players he wants, add Player to the Game otherwise change the GameState.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player.
      virtualView - the virtualview of the player.

    • getAvailableGods

      public java.util.List<ReducedGod> getAvailableGods()
      Returns:
      a List of available Gods.

    • getAvailableColors

      public java.util.List<Color> getAvailableColors()
      Returns:
      a List of available Colors.

    • getColorList

      public java.util.List<Color> getColorList()
      Returns:
      a list with all possible colors

    • getPlayersColors

      public java.util.List<Color> getPlayersColors()
      Returns the list of colors of players in nicknameQueue.
      Returns:
      a list of colors.

    • getActiveGods

      public java.util.List<ReducedGod> getActiveGods()
      Returns a List of Gods sorted with their own players.
      Returns:
      a List of Gods picked by the Challenger.

    • addVirtualView

      public void addVirtualView​(java.lang.String nickname, VirtualView virtualView)
      Adds a Player VirtualView to the controller if the first player max_players is not exceeded. Then adds a controller observer to the view. Adds the VirtualView to the game and board model observers.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the player nickname to identify his associated VirtualView.
      virtualView - the VirtualView to be added.

    • getVirtualViewMap

      public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​VirtualView> getVirtualViewMap()
      Returns:
      Virtual View Map.

    • removeVirtualView

      public void removeVirtualView​(java.lang.String nickname, boolean notifyEnabled)
      Removes a VirtualView from the controller.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the VirtualView associated.
      notifyEnabled - set to true to enable a lobby disconnection message, false otherwise.

    • broadcastGenericMessage

      public void broadcastGenericMessage​(java.lang.String messageToNotify, java.lang.String excludeNickname)
      Sends a Message which contains Game Information to all players but the one specified in the second argument.
      Parameters:
      messageToNotify - Message to send.
      excludeNickname - name of the player to be excluded from the broadcast.

    • broadcastGenericMessage

      public void broadcastGenericMessage​(java.lang.String messageToNotify)
      Sends a Message which contains Game Information to every Player in Game.
      Parameters:
      messageToNotify - Message to send.

    • broadcastDisconnectionMessage

      public void broadcastDisconnectionMessage​(java.lang.String nicknameDisconnected, java.lang.String text)
      Sends a broadcast disconnection message.
      Parameters:
      nicknameDisconnected - user who had a connection drop.
      text - generic text.

    • update

      public void update​(Message message)
      Receives an update message from the effect model.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      message - the update message.

    • checkLoginNickname

      public boolean checkLoginNickname​(java.lang.String nickname, View view)
      Verifies the nickname through the InputController.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname to be checked.
      view - the view of the player who is logging in.
      Returns:
      see InputController.checkLoginNickname(String, View)

    • isGameStarted

      public boolean isGameStarted()
      Checks if the game is already started, then no more players can connect.
      Returns:
      true if the game isn't started yet, false otherwise.

    • getTurnController

      public TurnController getTurnController()
      Return Turn Controller of the Game.
      Returns:
      Turn Controller of the Game.
